result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

1:32pm Hearing held via Zoom. Defendant Derrick Williams appears via video. Attorney William Schembera appeared via audio. Attorney Robert Stoiber appeared via video for the State of Wisconsin. There is not an agreement.

Status conference on October 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

11:45 AM case called and held via Zoom. Defendant Derrick T. Williams appeared by video.  Attorney William A. Schembera appeared by phone for Derrick T. Williams.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas- Received by the Court.

Case called at 1:31 AM.
Defendant Derrick T. Williams in court with Attorney William A. Schembera .  Attorney Afton Brianna Lewis  in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State calls Officer Kevin Putzy of the ECPD. He is sworn and testifies. Court takes judicial notice of the convictions in 20CM965 and 19CF364. No cross examination by Defense.
Court finds probable cause and binds the matter over.
Branch 5 to schedule ARGN.

1:58 PM case called. Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Derrick T. Williams in court.  Attorney William A. Schembera in court for Derrick T. Williams. 
2:08 AM case re called. Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Derrick T. Williams in court.  Attorney William A. Schembera in court for Derrick T. Williams. 
Parties agree to adjourn for two weeks. Defense waives time limits for the preliminary hearing.
